To chuse a Consort that may be

line_1: When one of Fate's great Family
line_2: Came up and seiz'd me for a Spy,

line_1: Perhaps she's descended of some family; —
line_2: Who, says Lady Pedigree, can this girl be;

line_1: He dwells amidst the Royal Family;
line_2: Then happy Man who shows the Tombs! said I,

line_1: Then rushing seiz'd the wretched family,
line_2: On barb'rous plunder bent, with savage eye

line_1: 'Till some sly sot, — "Not drink the family!"
line_2: At first to virtue firm, the glass I fly;

line_1: May you Enlarge the Royal Family,
line_2: And many Children's Children live to See.
And deign once more to bring with thee
Birds in their little Nests agree;
Sad fate of beauty! more I see,
